## Table of Contents

### Classes

* [`puppet_summary`](#puppet_summary): manage the puppet-summary deployment

## Classes

### <a name="puppet_summary"></a>`puppet_summary`

manage the puppet-summary deployment

* **See also**
  * https://github.com/skx/puppet-summary

#### Parameters

The following parameters are available in the `puppet_summary` class:

* [`version`](#version)
* [`port`](#port)
* [`ip`](#ip)
* [`user`](#user)
* [`group`](#group)
* [`homedir`](#homedir)
* [`shell`](#shell)

##### <a name="version"></a>`version`

Data type: `String[3]`

the version that should be pulled from GitHub

Default value: `'1.10'`

##### <a name="port"></a>`port`

Data type: `Stdlib::Port::Unprivileged`

port where the daemon should listen

Default value: `4321`

##### <a name="ip"></a>`ip`

Data type: `Stdlib::IP::Address::Nosubnet`

ip where the daemon should listen

Default value: `'127.0.0.1'`

##### <a name="user"></a>`user`

Data type: `String[1]`

username that should be created

Default value: `'puppet-summary'`

##### <a name="group"></a>`group`

Data type: `String[1]`

groupname that should be created

Default value: `$user`

##### <a name="homedir"></a>`homedir`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

home directory for the new user

Default value: `"/opt/${user}"`

##### <a name="shell"></a>`shell`

Data type: `Stdlib::Absolutepath`

the new shell for the new user

Default value: `$facts['os']['family']`
